2.text: Stir your eggs with a silicone spatula.

3.text: Add milk, cream, or crème fraîche for creamier, fluffier eggs.

4.text: Season your eggs right before they finish cooking.

5.text: Crack the eggs directly into the pan.

6.text: Remove the eggs from the heat right before they finish cooking.

7.text: Add in tasty toppings, like cheese, chives, or even chopped olives.

8.text: Chop your chives and set them to the side.

9.text: Crack your eggs straight into a deep, unheated saucepan.

10.text: Put the cubed butter into the pan along with the eggs.

11.text: Turn the burner heat to high and continuously stir the eggs.

12.text: Lift the pan off of the heat every 30 seconds for 10 seconds at a time.

13.text: Season the eggs and add the crème fraîche right as they finish cooking.

14.text: Remove the eggs from the heat right before they finish cooking.

15.text: Transfer the eggs to a plate and garnish with the chopped chives.
